intro: Stenogyne rugosa var. monticola, commonly known as the rough stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are rough to the touch, giving it its common name, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. This variety is considered rare and is often found in specific microhabitats on the island of Oahu.
